data.title: Procurement: liquid fuels framework
data.meta_description: Guidance for Scottish public sector organisations on how to access and use the framework.
data.text:
Who can access: all public sector who participated in CCS procurement competition

Contract status: live

Dates of contract: 01 April 2023 to 31 March 2025 (with an option of 2 x 12 month extension periods)

Category: utilities - National

Overview

A national collaborative contract for the bulk supply of liquid fuels.

This is a collaborative contract, not a framework agreement, therefore there is no facility for public bodies to call-off or run mini competitions.

What is in scope

This contract covers:

Heating oil

gas oil class A2 (agricultural or heating purposes)

heating oil substitute

kerosene

gas oil class D

Automotive fuel

adblue

petrol

diesel

Marine oil

marine oil

Who can use this

Only those public bodies who participated as part of the CCS procurement exercise in February 2023.

Note: If you are a new public body with a significant requirement please contact billy.lawson@gov.scot

Benefits

The benefits of this contract include:

across all suppliers, employees are paid at least the Scottish Living Wage

suppliers provide employee opportunities for learning and development

lowest possible price for delivery of liquid fuel across the whole of Scotland

clear and transparent pricing

comprehensive management information

improved customer service

consistent quality of product

reliance/continuity of supply/regional coverage

community benefits

fixed successful bidders margin for entire agreement term, including any extensions

weekly Platts pricing provided to monitor spend

Suppliers

Certas trading as Scottish Fuels Ltd

Highland Fuels Ltd

Further information

Framework documents, including all relevant Framework Agreements can be found on the CCS website

To add or change an existing delivery site, please contact: billy.lawson@gov.scot
